block.p: NASHUA CORP., Nashua, N.H., an office copy and computer products company, said its shareholders had re-elected its current directors, fending off a challenge by Newcastle Partners, Dallas, an investment group holding about 2 percent of Nashua's stock.
AMERICAN TOWER CORP., Boston, an owner of broadcast and wireless-communications towers, has agreed to buy General Telecom, New York, a telephone switching company, for $30 million.

NPC INTERNATIONAL INC., Pittsburg, Kan., the largest Pizza Hut restaurant franchisee, agreed to buy 65 restaurants from Tricon Global Restaurants, Louisville, Ky., an owner of fast-food restaurants, to expand in Iowa, Illinois and Georgia. Terms were not disclosed.
CORNING INC., Corning, N.Y., plans to hire 200 more people at its Photonics Technology plant, in Erwin, N.Y., which produces optical fiber equipment.
